poem.author: Peter McCarey
poem.text: If the creature's flawed, the fault is with the maker. But when a cratur cracks, who gets the blame? I've fawned on none But the fraud faith in an absent faither Instilled by two fond parents who were there Till the dice of my vertebrae straightened like a frond In that cold wind. Struggle with silk buttons on a frogged tunic, And laws that flogged and goaded me, but protected her. These kodak memories will have fobbed me off until I'm old, Sat there drinking tea. The windscreen fogged a rainy firth Till all the well and ill-formed movements of the heart Reveal themselves to one no longer able to take them in: foiled again.
